text: this single-celled organism is Stentor
it is a close relative of Paramecium and
at 1 millimeter it is just barely big
enough to see what the naked eye the
beating hairlike structures on its
surface are called cilia as they beat
the cilia create a current this current
propels spent or as a twists and turns
in search of food and habitat cilia are
found in many organisms including
ourselves among other things they create
a current along the surface of our
Airways that sweeps mucus and dirt from
our lungs most larger organisms don't
move with cilia the many independent
cilia just aren't effective of
propelling big things and other
approaches such as fins or legs
powered by muscles are needed the Tina 4
is also known as comb jellies are an
exception this tina 4 is mimi OPS's
which grows to be about the size of an
apple
nimi abscess is pelagic it spends its
whole life swimming in the ocean
nimi abscess and other Tina fors are the
largest organisms to be propelled by
cilia Tina for cilia are highly modified
and are arranged into specialized
structures called combs and can move
such a large organism each psyllium
doesn't move independently as in tiny
stentorian instead the cilia of each
comb function together as a paddle the
combs in turn are organized into rows
along the body and their motion is
coordinated across the whole and
the tightly packed cilia within each
comb are crystal like this causes each
cone to refract light splitting white
light into a rainbow of colors as the
combs move at slightly different angles
from their neighbors it appears as if
colored lights are shooting up and down
the sides of the illuminated
you
